head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 17/6/67 ¶ ¶ It is but right, dear Mr Fitzgibbon, that I should express to the City Council my best thanks for their goodness of providing the nearer access now to the bot. Gard...

div.p: No. 3313, unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

It is but right, dear Mr Fitzgibbon, that I should express to the City Council my best thanks for their goodness of providing the nearer access now to the bot. Garden from East Melbourne by the passage near the Engine House. To show in some small way my gratitude I will supply to Mr Hyndman one hundred Chilian Araucarias, which I have for the first time now raised & which under Mr Hyndmans care would be large enough next autumn to find permanent places on Municipal Ground. I beg to remind you of your friendly interest to cause such arrangements to be made as will enable me to remove the 3rails fence now in half ruins standing in the swamp at the city bridge. If still a drinking place is needed there after the Yan Yean has become so accessible it could be readily provided opposite the Sandridge road.
Let me remain your very regardful

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. Mueller.
MS file annotation: 'H. C. | T.C. to reply' [Health Committee, Town Clerk to reply]. See E. FitzGibbon to M, 3 August 1867.
